key_points: New alleged threats against Colorado Springs schools deemed uncredible by authorities.
Chinook Trail Middle School and Elementary School were the subjects of social media threats.
Schools share a campus on the northeast side of Colorado Springs.
Colorado Springs Police Department identified involved students and found no credible threat.
Parents were allowed to keep their children home, despite schools remaining open.
Increased school threats attributed to recent national incidents, like the Michigan high school shooting.
Security measures and close coordination with police emphasized to keep schools safe.
Misinformation and rumor spreading on social media hindered police investigation.
Specific rumors included outdated photos misinterpreted as threats and unfounded 'hit list'.
Police urge public to report incidents through official channels like Safe2Tell, not social media.
spokespersons: Lt. James Sokolik (Colorado Springs Police Department)
Tom Andrew (Principal, Chinook Trail Middle School)
Pat Schumaker (Principal, Chinook Trail Elementary School)
